ground_truth.canonical_answer: No. Soil and groundwater samples show no contamination pattern consistent with brownfield migration. The chromium pattern shows a sharp point source between WQ-02 and WQ-03, not diffuse groundwater contamination.

questions.prompt: If the chromium elevation were caused by natural geological weathering, what pattern would you expect? Does the data match?

ground_truth.canonical_answer: Geological weathering would produce gradual, diffuse chromium elevation across all stations with no sharp spatial gradient. Instead, the data shows a stark point-source pattern with upstream stations clean and peak concentration at WQ-03. This rules out natural weathering.
